snippet: George Manahan conducted the Manhattan School of Music Chamber Sinfonia in the New York premiere of “Come Up From the Fields Father,” Richard Danielpour’s setting of a Walt Whitman poem.
abstract: Steve Smith reviews New York premiere of musical work Come Up From the Fields Father, composed by Richard Danielpour from a Walt Whitman poem and performed by the Manhattan School of Music Chamber Sinfonia, with George Manahan conducting.
lead_paragraph: George Manahan conducted the Manhattan School of Music Chamber Sinfonia in the New York premiere of “Come Up From the Fields Father,” Richard Danielpour’s setting of a Walt Whitman poem.

headline.seo: Manhattan School of Music Chamber Sinfonia
headline.main: Double Feature: New Music With Old Soul
